scripts.pypoe:pull: cd ../.. && git subtree pull --squash --prefix=packages/datamine/PyPoE https://github.com/OmegaK2/PyPoE.git dev
scripts.//export:main: bash -c "mkdir -p dist && pypoe_exporter config set ggpk_path \"`cat ggpk_paths/en`\" && pypoe_exporter dat json dist/all.json && date > dist/date"
scripts.export:main: bash -c "mkdir -p dist && pypoe_exporter config set ggpk_path \"`cat ggpk_paths/en`\" && pypoe_exporter dat json dist/all.json --files `node src/mainFilenames.js` && date > dist/date"
scripts.export:lang: bash -c "yarn export:lang:en && yarn export:lang:fr && yarn export:lang:de && yarn export:lang:ko && yarn export:lang:pt && yarn export:lang:ru && yarn export:lang:es && yarn export:lang:th"
scripts.export:lang:en: bash -c "pypoe_exporter config set ggpk_path \"`cat ggpk_paths/en`\" && pypoe_exporter dat json dist/lang/en.json --files `node src/langFilenames.js`"
scripts.export:lang:fr: bash -c "pypoe_exporter config set ggpk_path \"`cat ggpk_paths/en`\" && pypoe_exporter dat json dist/lang/fr.json --lang French --files `node src/langFilenames.js`"

scripts.//export:lang:zh: This one's tricky: Chinese is not included with the English PoE download. I have to aim it at a separately-downloaded content.ggpk.
scripts.export:lang:zh: bash -c "pypoe_exporter config set ggpk_path \"`cat ggpk_paths/zh`\" && pypoe_exporter dat json dist/lang/zh.json --lang \"Simplified Chinese\" --files `node src/langFilenames.js`"
scripts.//export:zh: Because downloading Chinese-PoE is a pain, I don't want to require it for the build. dist/lang/zh.json is git-committed (unlike other language exports), and `yarn export` won't rebuild it. `yarn export:zh` will.
scripts.wiki: yarn wiki:atlasbase && yarn wiki:divcards && yarn wiki:leagues
